statements: UPDATE architects SET collaboration_status = TRUE, architect_name = 'John Doe' WHERE architect_id = 1;
UPDATE architects SET project_id = 1001, collaboration_status = FALSE WHERE architect_name = 'Jane Smith';
UPDATE architects SET architect_name = 'John Doe', project_id = 123, collaboration_status = TRUE WHERE architect_id = 1;
UPDATE architects SET project_id = 456, architect_name = 'Alice Smith', collaboration_status = FALSE WHERE collaboration_status = TRUE;
UPDATE architects SET email='new_email@example.com' WHERE architect_id=1;
UPDATE collaborations SET notes='Important collaboration' WHERE collab_id=5;
UPDATE architects SET phone_number = '123-456-7890', email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE architect_id = 1;
UPDATE collaborations SET notes = 'Meeting rescheduled to next week' WHERE collab_id = 10;
UPDATE architects SET email = 'new_email@example.com', phone_number = '123-456-7890' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE projects SET start_date = '2023-01-01', description = 'Updated description' WHERE project_name = 'Project ABC';
UPDATE architects SET email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE projects SET description = 'Updated project description', start_date = '2023-01-01' WHERE id = 2;
UPDATE architects SET email='newemail@example.com' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE projects SET start_date='2022-07-15' WHERE project_name='Project X';
UPDATE architects SET email='new.email@example.com', phone_number='123-456-7890' WHERE id=1
UPDATE projects SET start_date='2023-01-01', end_date='2023-12-31' WHERE project_name='Project X'
UPDATE architects SET architect_name = 'John Doe', company_name = 'Architecture Inc' WHERE architect_id = 1;
UPDATE projects SET budget = 15000.00, start_date = '2022-04-01' WHERE project_id = 2;
UPDATE architects SET company_name = 'New Company', email = 'new_email@example.com' WHERE architect_id = 1;
UPDATE projects SET budget = 15000.50, end_date = '2023-10-31' WHERE project_id = 3;
